tit.cmt: カッコの内容は削除しました。

sen.j: ニギハヤヒノミコトは、日本神話に登場する神 (神道)。
sen.e: Nigihayahi no Mikoto is a Shinto deity who appears in Japanese Mythology.
Nigihayahi no Mikoto is a Shinto deity who appears in Japanese Mythology.
Nigihayahi no Mikoto is a god (Shinto) who appears in Japanese mythology.

sen.j: 『日本書紀で』は饒速日命、『古事記』では邇藝速日命と表記する。
sen.e: The name of Nigihayahi no Mikoto is written "饒速日命" in the "Nihonshoki", and "邇藝速日命" in the "Kojiki".
The name of Nigihayahi no Mikoto is written "饒速日命" in the "Nihonshoki", and "邇藝速日命" in the "Kojiki".
It is written "饒速日命" in the "Nihonshoki" (The Chronicles of Japan), and "邇藝速日命" in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters).
sen.cmt: ここが初出ですので、古事記、日本書紀 の補足を追加しました。

sen.j: 『古事記』では、神武天皇の神武東征において大和国地方の豪族である長髄彦が奉じる神として登場する。
sen.e: In the Jinmu tosei (the Eastern expedition of the Emperor Jinmu) in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), Nigihayahi no Mikoto appears as a deity enshrined by Nagatsunehiko, who was a powerful local clan in the region of Yamato Province.

In the Jinmu tosei (the Eastern expedition of the Emperor Jinmu) in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), Nigihayahi no Mikoto appears as a deity enshrined by Nagatsunehiko, who was a powerful local clan in the region of Yamato Province.

In the Jinmu tosei (the Eastern expedition of the Emperor Jinmu) in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), Nigihayahi no Mikoto appears as a deity enshrined by Nagatsunehiko, who was a powerful local clan in the region of Yamato Province.

sen.j: ナガスネヒコの妹のトミヤスビメ（登美夜須毘売）を妻とし、トミヤスビメとの間にウマシマジノミコト（宇摩志麻遅命）をもうけた。
sen.e: He made Tomiyasubime, a younger sister of Nagasunehiko, his wife and they had a boy, Umashimaji no Mikoto.
He made Tomiyasubime, a younger sister of Nagasunehiko, his wife and they had a boy, Umashimaji no Mikoto.
He made Tomiyasubime, a younger sister of Nagasunehiko, his wife and they had a boy, Umashimaji no Mikoto.

sen.j: ウマシマジノミコトは、物部氏、穂積氏、采女氏の祖としている。
sen.e: Umashimaji no Mikoto was regarded as the ancestor of the Mononobe Clan, the Hozumi Clan and the Uneme Clan.
Umashimaji no Mikoto was regarded as the ancestor of the Mononobe Clan, the Hozumi Clan and the Uneme Clan.
Umashimaji no Mikoto was regarded as the ancestor of the Mononobe clan, the Hozumi clan and the Uneme clan.

sen.j: イワレビコ（後の神武天皇）が東征し、それに抵抗したナガスネヒコが敗れた。
sen.e: In the Eastern expedition of Iwarebiko (the future Emperor Jinmu), Nagatsunehiko fought Iwarebiko but was defeated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 「he」という代名詞を使うと混乱しそうなところは人名を入れました。
sen.e: In the Eastern expedition of Iwarebiko (the future Emperor Jinmu), Nagatsunehiko fought Iwarebiko but was defeated.
In the Eastern expedition of Iwarebiko (the future Emperor Jinmu), Nagatsunehiko fought Iwarebiko but was defeated.

sen.j: その後、イワレビコがアマテラスの子孫であることを知り、イワレビコのもとに下った。
sen.e: And afterward, Nigihayahi no Mikoto submitted himself to Iwarebiko because he found out that Iwarebiko was the descendant of Amaterasu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 「
sen.e: And afterward, Nigihayahi no Mikoto submitted himself to Iwarebiko because he found out that Iwarebiko was the descendant of Amaterasu.
And afterward, Nigihayahi no Mikoto submitted himself to Iwarebiko because he found out that Iwarebiko was the descendant of Amaterasu.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』などの記述によれば、神武東征に先立ち、アマテラスから十種の神宝を授かり天磐船に乗って河内国(大阪府交野市)の河上の地に天降った。
sen.e: According to the "Nihonshoki" (the Chronicles of Japan), prior to the Jinmu tensei, Nigihayahi received ten kinds of Shinpo (ten kinds of sacred treasures) from Amaterasu (the Sun goddess) and he took Amenoiwafune ship to descend to Kawakami in Kawachi Province (Katano City, Osaka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to the "Nihonshoki" (the Chronicles of Japan), prior to the Jinmu tensei, Nigihayahi received ten kinds of Shinpo (ten kinds of sacred treasures) from Amaterasu (the Sun goddess) and he took Amenoiwafune ship to descend to Kawakami in Kawachi Province (Katano City, Osaka Prefecture).

According to the "Nihonshoki," prior to the Jinmu tosei (eastern expedition of the Emperor Jinmu), Nigihayahi received ten kinds of Shinpo (ten kinds of sacred treasures) from Amaterasu and he took Amenoiwafune ship to descend to Kawakami in Kawachi Province (Katano City, Osaka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 日本書紀 既出のため、補足を削除しました。

sen.j: その後大和国(奈良県)に移ったとされている。
sen.e: Then he seemed to move to Yamato Province (Nara prefecture).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then he seemed to move to Yamato Province (Nara prefecture).
Then he seemed to move to Yamato Province (Nara Prefecture).

sen.j: これらは、ニニギの天孫降臨説話とは別系統の説話と考えられる。
sen.e: The above story was considered to come from a different source, not from the legend of "Tensonkorin"(Descent to Earth of Ninigi, who was a descendant of the Sun Goddess).
The above story was considered to come from a different source, not from the legend of "Tensonkorin"(Descent to Earth of Ninigi, who was a descendant of the Sun Goddess).
The above story was considered to come from a different source, not from the legend of "Tensonkorin" (Descent to Earth of Ninigi, who was a descendant of the Sun Goddess).
sen.cmt: スペースを追加しました。

sen.j: また、有力な氏族、特に祭祀を司どる物部氏の祖神とされていること、神武天皇より先に大和に鎮座していることが神話に明記されている。
sen.e: Nigihayahi no Mikoto has been regarded as an ancestor deity of the powerful clans, especially of the Mononobe clan, who was in charge of Saishi (religious services) while the Japanese mythology clearly mentions that he was settled in Yamato Province prior to the Emperor Jinmu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Nigihayahi no Mikoto has been regarded as an ancestor deity of the powerful clans, especially of the Mononobe clan, who was in charge of Saishi (religious services) while the Japanese mythology clearly mentions that he was settled in Yamato Province prior to the Emperor Jinmu.

Nigihayahi no Mikoto has been regarded as an ancestor deity of the powerful clans, especially of the Mononobe clan, who was in charge of Saishi (religious services) while the Japanese Mythology clearly mentions that he was settled in Yamato Province prior to the Emperor Jinmu.
sen.cmt: Japanese Mythology として統一しました。

sen.j: ニギハヤヒの存在には多くの重要な問題が含まれている。
sen.e: This means, the existence of Nigihayahi implies many important subjects
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This means, the existence of Nigihayahi implies many important subjects
This means, the existence of Nigihayahi implies many important subjects.
sen.cmt: 文末にピリオドを追加しました。

sen.j: 大和地方に神武天皇の前に出雲系の王権が存在したことを示すとする説がある。
sen.e: There is a theory that sovereign power by Izumo family already existed in Yamato Province before the Emperor Jinmu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「出雲系」が不明です。"Deity"と"Clan"両方についてのことかもしれないので"Family"としました。
sen.e: There is a theory that sovereign power by Izumo family already existed in Yamato Province before the Emperor Jinmu.
There is a theory that sovereign power by Izumo family already existed in Yamato Province before the Emperor Jinmu.

sen.j: 大和地方に存在した何らかの勢力と物部氏に結びつきがあったとする説などもある。
sen.e: There are also other theories, such as, the Mononobe clan tied up with political power in the region of Yamato.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There are also other theories, such as, that the Mononobe clan was tied up politically in the region of Yamato.
There are also other theories, such as, that the Mononobe clan was tied up politically in the region of Yamato.

sen.j: 『先代旧事本紀』では、「天照國照彦天火明櫛玉饒速日尊」（あまてる くにてるひこ あまのほあかり くしたま にぎはやひ の みこと）といいアメノオシホミミの子でニニギの兄である天火明命（アメノホアカリ）と同一の神であるとしている。
sen.e: In the "Sendai Kujihongi" (the Ancient Japanese History), Nigihayahi (no Mikoto) was called Amateru Kuniteruhiko Akima no Hoakari Kushitama Nigihayaki no Mikoto, and regarded as the same deity as Amenohoakari, who was the son of Amenooshihomimi and the older brother of Ninigi.

In the "Sendai Kujihongi" (the Ancient Japanese History), Nigihayahi (no Mikoto) was called Amateru Kuniteruhiko Akima no Hoakari Kushitama Nigihayaki no Mikoto, and regarded as the same deity as Amenohoakari, who was the son of Amenooshihomimi and the older brother of Ninigi.

In the "Sendai Kujihongi" (the Ancient Japanese History), Nigihayahi (no Mikoto) was called 'Amateru Kuniteruhiko Akima no Hoakari Kushitama Nigihayaki no Mikoto,' and regarded as the same deity as Amenohoakari, who was the son of Amenooshihomimi and the older brother of Ninigi.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィーで人名を囲みました。

sen.j: 『新撰姓氏録』ではニギハヤヒは、天神（高天原出身、皇統ではない）、天火明命（アメノホアカリ）は天孫（天照大神の系）とし両者を別とする。
sen.e: In the "Shinsen Shojiroku" (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility), Nigihayahi was Tenjin (a deity from Takamagahara, who was not in the imperial line) while Amenohoakari was Tenson (the Imperial lineage, a decendant of Amaterasu).

In the "Shinsen Shojiroku" (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility), Nigihayahi was Tenjin (a deity from Takamagahara, who was not in the imperial line) while Amenohoakari was Tenson (the Imperial lineage, a decendant of Amaterasu).

In the "Shinsen Shojiroku" (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility), Nigihayahi was Tenjin (a deity from Takamagahara, who was not in the imperial line) while Amenohoakari was Tenson (the Imperial lineage, a descendant of Amaterasu).

sen.j: 天照御魂神
sen.e: Ameterumitamano-kam
Ameterumitamano-kam
Ameterumitama no Kami
sen.cmt: 神名表現を統一しました。

sen.j: スサノオノミコトの子であり、大物主、加茂別雷大神、事解之男尊、日本大国魂大神、布留御魂,大歳尊と同一視する説
sen.e: There is a theory that Nigihayahi was a son of Susano no Mikoto, and was equated with Omononushi, Kamowakeikazuchi-no-okami, Kotosakao no Mikoto, Yamato no Okunitama no Okami, Furunomitama, and Otoshi no Mikoto.

There is a theory that Nigihayahi was a son of Susano no Mikoto, and was equated with Omononushi, Kamowakeikazuchi-no-okami, Kotosakao no Mikoto, Yamato no Okunitama no Okami, Furunomitama, and Otoshi no Mikoto.

There is a theory that Nigihayahi was a son of Susanoo no Mikoto, and was equated with Omononushi, Kamowakeikazuchi no Okami, Kotosakao no Mikoto, Yamato no Okunitama no Okami, Furunomitama, and Otoshi no Mikoto.
sen.cmt: 神名表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 古代史ブームの火付け役と目される原田常治氏は、推論に推論を重ね、大胆に結論を断定する手法で、大神神社の主祭神である大物主、上賀茂神社の主祭神である加茂別雷大神、熊野本宮大社の祭神である事解之男尊、大和神社の主神である日本大国魂大神、石上神宮の祭神である布留御魂、大歳神社の主祭神である大歳神(大歳尊)と同一だとする。
sen.e: Tshuneji HARADA, who sparked the ancient history boom, took a bold approach, and repeating the inference, he came to conclude that Nigihayahi was equated with Omononushi, who was the chief enshrined deity of Okami-jinjya Shrine, Kamowakeikazuchi no Okami, who was the chief enshrined deity of Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, Kotosakao no Mikoto, who was the enshrined deity of Kumanohongu-taisha Shrine, Yamato no Okunitama no Okami, who was the chief deity of Yamato-jinja Shrine, Furunomitama, who was the enshried deity of Isonokami-jingu Shrine, and Otoshi-no-mikoto, who was the chief enshrined deity of Otoshi-jinja Shrine.

Tshuneji HARADA, who sparked the ancient history boom, took a bold approach, and repeating the inference, he came to conclude that Nigihayahi was equated with Omononushi, who was the chief enshrined deity of Okami-jinjya Shrine, Kamowakeikazuchi no Okami, who was the chief enshrined deity of Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, Kotosakao no Mikoto, who was the enshrined deity of Kumanohongu-taisha Shrine, Yamato no Okunitama no Okami, who was the chief deity of Yamato-jinja Shrine, Furunomitama, who was the enshried deity of Isonokami-jingu Shrine, and Otoshi-no-mikoto, who was the chief enshrined deity of Otoshi-jinja Shrine.

Tshuneji HARADA, who sparked the ancient history boom, took a bold approach, and repeating the inference, he came to conclude that Nigihayahi was equated with Omononushi, who was the chief enshrined deity of Okami-jinja Shrine, Kamowakeikazuchi no Okami, who was the chief enshrined deity of Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, Kotosakao no Mikoto, who was the enshrined deity of Kumanohongu-taisha Shrine, Yamato no Okunitama no Okami, who was the chief deity of Yamato-jinja Shrine, Furunomitama, who was the enshried deity of Isonokami-jingu Shrine, and Otoshi no Mikoto, who was the chief enshrined deity of Otoshi-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。神名表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 学術的には大いに問題があるという意見がある一方、影響を受けた作家も多く、多くの読者に読まれてきた経緯もあり、古代史へのロマンを広げる説であるという意見もある。
sen.e: Although some people consider that there are many academic problems with his theory, others think it evokes a sense of Romanticism to the ancient history, inspiring quite a few writers.
Although some people consider that there are many academic problems with his theory, others think it evokes a sense of Romanticism to the ancient history, inspiring quite a few writers.
